reviews.text:
A magnificent temple dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva.. As a non Hindu, I found the guided tour of the temple and surrounding sites by our tour company Enchanting Travels to be well researched and informative and the huge temple grounds a must do when visiting Chennai.
We are here during the annual event of 2025. It was an amazing experience.

"Visited and it was truly a serene experience! The architecture is stunning, and the atmosphere is so peaceful. The priests were welcoming, and the rituals were performed with devotion. I felt a deep sense of spirituality and connection. Highly recommend for those seeking solace and tranquility. A must-visit!"

Visited Kapaleeswarar Temple recently, and it was truly a beautiful experience. The gopuram is stunning with its intricate carvings ‚Äì you can spend quite some time just admiring the details. Inside, the temple has a very peaceful atmosphere despite being busy most of the time. the chants and lamps made it feel even more spiritual.

The area around the temple is also lively with small shops and traditional food stalls, which adds to the charm. Parking can be a bit tricky, and the crowd is usually heavy, but that's expected at such a famous temple. If you're in Chennai, this is definitely a must-visit, both for the architecture and the divine experience.

places.name: Besant Nagar Beach

reviews.text:
My Favourite spot in Chennai.
Morning sunrise view is an Eye Catchy.

Besant Nagar Beach, also known as Edward Elliot's Beach is one of the most popular and serene beaches in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. Located in the upscale neighborhood of Besant Nagar, this beach is a favorite spot for locals and tourists looking for a peaceful seaside experience.

Highlights

Scenic Beauty: A clean and less crowded alternative to Marina Beach, offering beautiful sunrise and sunset views.

Restaurants & Cafes: The area around the beach is home to many famous eateries like Murugan Idli Shop, Jonah's Bistro, and Mash Resto Caf√©.

The nearby Ashtalakshmi Temple and Velankanni Church attract visitors for spiritual experiences.

A great place for morning or evening walks, jogging, or just relaxing by the sea.

I recently visited Besant Nagar Beach, and I must say, it's one of the most beautiful and serene beaches I've ever been to! Located in the heart of Chennai, this beach is a tranquil oasis that's perfect for a relaxing day out.

Cleanliness and Maintenance:
The beach is actually clean and well-maintained.

Scenic Views:
The beach offers breathtaking views of the Bay of Bengal, especially during sunrise and sunset. The picturesque Elliot's Promenade, which runs along the beach, is perfect for a leisurely walk or jog.

Food and Drink Options:
There are plenty of food stalls and restaurants nearby, offering a range of delicious food options and other local cuisine. Don't forget to try some of the fresh coconut water and local snacks!

Overall Experience:
Besant Nagar Beach is an absolute must-visit if you're in Chennai! Whether you're looking to relax, take a leisurely walk, or simply enjoy the scenic views, this beach has something for everyone.

Tips and Recommendations

- Best time to visit: Early morning or late evening to avoid the crowds and heat.
- Wear comfortable clothing and footwear, and don't forget your sunscreen and sunglasses!
- Try some of the local food options at the nearby restaurants.
- Be mindful of your belongings and personal safety, especially during peak hours.

Originally planned to visit other spots but somehow ended up here instead. üåä Reached around 4 PM, and it was a bit sunny with hardly anyone around. Within an hour, while we were at a nearby shop, the place got Crowded-seems like we picked the perfect timing! üì∏ Got some good clicks too!

I had visited this beach ages ago, but it has Developed significantly since then. Noticed some great improvements, like a ramp for the physically challenged ‚ôø and an increase in the number of shops. The beach is full of vibrant energy, with plenty of activities and games to enjoy. üèñÔ∏èüéà

Compared to Marina & Pattinapakkam, this place has a unique charm for me-maybe a personal connection, who knows? üòÑ Besant Nagar Beach feels quieter, cleaner, and well-organized, making it perfect for a Peaceful walk, reading, or simply enjoying the waves. üåä‚ú® Definitely a must-visit spot!

places.generalDescription: Arignar Anna Zoological Park, located in Vandalur just 32 kilometers from Chennai, is a sprawling haven for wildlife enthusiasts and families alike. Covering an impressive 1260 acres, it stands as the largest zoo of its kind in Southeast Asia. This remarkable park features expansive natural enclosures that allow visitors to observe a diverse array of flora and fauna up close. With around 138 species on display, including both endemic and exotic animals, it's truly a paradise for nature lovers.

sources.snippet: Arignar Anna Zoological Park is, of course, one of the greatest places to visit in Chennai for lovers because it offers a green and peaceful environment, diverse wildlife, and opportunities for quiet strolls. Recently, the zoo welcomed a pair of Egyptian vultures, five mottled wood owls, and three Himalayan griffons, increasing the interest of visitors. With easy accessibility and memorable moments to capture, it is a perfect one-day outing suggestion in Chennai for couples who enjoy nature and wildlife.

places.name: Arignar Anna Zoological Park

reviews.text:
Had a good time visiting the Anna Geology Museum and Vandalur Zoo last Sunday. It's a great place for families and kids to explore and learn about wildlife and geology. The overall experience was enjoyable, and the place is well-maintained.

However, since April is quite hot, the walking paths get really exhausting due to the high temperatures. It would be great if more trees and shaded plant areas are added along the way to give some relief from the sun.

One concern I noticed was a deer that had escaped its enclosure and was eating human-discarded food. While it was surprising to see, it also shows the need for better monitoring and care in the deer section to avoid any risks to the animals or visitors.

On the positive side, they support both cash and QR code payments, which is very convenient in this digital age. But one important suggestion: there was no clear notice or signage informing visitors that online payment can be done directly through a QR code without standing in the ticket queue. I waited in a long queue only to be told at the counter to scan and book online via WhatsApp chatbot. This needs to be highlighted with proper boards at the entrance to save visitors' time.

Despite these small issues, the zoo offers a rich and diverse experience and is definitely worth visiting. A few improvements can make it even better!

Great zoo,home to an impressive diversity of animals. The place is huge, so it's always fun to rent a bicycle and ride around. It's best to come early, around 9am. It can get really hot later on, so gear up accordingly. The enclosures are a bit old, but still good enough for some nice photos and clear views.Overall it's a fun place to spend a few hours with nature and wildlife.

Arignar Anna Zoological Park is a serene and green space perfect for a one-time family visit. The zoo has a good variety of animals, though viewing can be tricky since many enclosures are set at a distance. Navigation inside the park can be a little confusing due to limited signage, so a map or guidance would help. Overall, it's a clean, well-kept place worth checking out if you enjoy nature and wildlife

places.generalDescription: Nestled within the sprawling 16-acre Pantheon Complex, the Government Museum Chennai is a treasure trove of art and history that dates back to its establishment in 1851. This museum features an eclectic mix of collections, including Indian art and sculpture, bronzes from the illustrious Chola Dynasty, and fascinating anthropological artifacts. Visitors can explore various buildings like the Museum Theatre with its stunning Italianate architecture and the Indo-Saracenic National Gallery of Art facade.

sources.snippet: The Government Museum in Egmore in Chennai is a treasure trove for art and history fanatics alike. This museum is one of the oldest in India and has an extensive collection of historical artefacts spanning various eras. It has a large repository of diverse exhibits ranging from art, archaeology, anthropology, numismatics, and ancient sculptural specimens.

places.name: Wild Gardencafe

reviews.text: This restaurant is an oasis in the heart of the city! The moment you step inside, the lush greenery transports you to a peaceful world. The interiors are impressive, with beautiful flooring and AC indoor seating. But the outdoor seating truly shines - surrounded by lush greenery, uniquely designed lamps add a warm glow, and the quirky chairs and tables make it a charming spot. The outdoor seating area feels like a secret garden, perfect for relaxation. The food is exceptional, with standout pizzas, delicious chicken dishes, and mouthwatering desserts. But the real highlight for me was the abundance of friendly cats roaming around - a cat lover's paradise! Definitely worth visiting again and again for the outdoor seating, food, and feline friends!"

Went there for a late Saturday brunch after getting recommendations from a couple of friends regarding the location and ambience of this cafe. It's located in the heart of the city but the whole area is covered with trees and plants and makes you feel you're somewhere way out of the city.

Coming to the food, we ordered one Pesto Fusili pasta with potato and beans and omlette along with iced cappuccinos. Everything were delicious and filling. They have cocktails on the menu as well along with a bakery with a lot of cakes and pastry options.
Overall a great experience but we felt the price is a bit on the higher side. Will definitely recommend this for a leisurely weekend breakfast/brunch.

Visited Wild Garden Cafe in Chennai ‚Äì no doubt, the ambience is absolutely beautiful and peaceful. It's a great place for pictures or just to chill for a while.

But the food and service were a huge letdown.
We ordered cold coffee, hazelnut cappuccino, and chicken pizza ‚Äì none of them were good.
Cold coffee tasted like diluted water, not even cold. The cappuccino had too much froth and lacked flavour. And the pizza? The chicken felt undercooked and totally off.

On top of that, it's super expensive, and we literally spent 20 minutes just trying to figure out the menu ‚Äì nothing was clear and the waiter wasn't helpful.

Might visit again just for the peaceful vibe, but definitely not for the food.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the bustling heart of Chennai, Guindy National Park stands as a serene oasis amidst urban life. This lush green space, rich in history and biodiversity, was once part of the colonial Guindy Lodge, which served as the residence for British governors. Today, it is recognized as one of India's smallest national parks and offers a delightful escape for families. With its sprawling trees and diverse wildlife, visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls while spotting various animals that call this park home.

sources.snippet: Guindy National Park | #10 of 18 Best Places to Visit in Chennai with Girlfriend. Despite Guindy National Park situated in the center of the city, it is quiet and serene. The park has a variety of flora and fauna, and many paths wherein you can walk hand in hand.

places.name: Guindy National Park

reviews.text: Calm, neat and peaceful children's park. Well maintained. Walkway are clean. Drinking water facility and restroom are available inside the park. There are two Kids play area with well maintained equipment's. Many types of birds, reptiles, snakes and animals available. Almost every cabin are filled with sufficient population. Most of the area are covered with trees, so don't worry about the sun. Wheelchair can also go everywhere. Entrance fee sixty for adult and ten rupees for child above 5 years. Paid Car parking available. There is a cafeteria near the entry gate of the park. Inside the park there is no food court available. So better plan accordingly. Go for it if you're looking to spend 2 to 3 hours of time with family.

Guindy National Park, nestled in the heart of Chennai, is one of India's smallest national parks

The park is a sanctuary for a variety of species. An array of bird species, including kingfishers and woodpeckers. The park's diverse plant life further enhances its ecological significance.

The park's serene environment and the opportunity to observe wildlife in their natural habitats. The Children's Park and the adjacent Snake Park are particularly popular among families, offering educational and recreational experiences for children.

The park's size is relatively small compared to other national parks, animals like peacocks and expecting a larger array of species

Timings: The park is open from 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM,

Entry Fees for park

The chance to observe various species make it a worthwhile visit for nature enthusiasts and families

Guindy National Park is honestly just a super chill spot to hang out. Great for kids and adults-there's loads of deer and birds to see, and the whole place is really green and spacious. You can just sit around, play games, or have a simple picnic without feeling crowded. It's way nicer than being stuck inside the city. If you're up for some easygoing time in nature, totally check it out!

places.name: East Coast at Madras Square

reviews.text: Lovely experience every time! I've been here a couple of times now, and the food has always been consistently delicious. The ambiance is warm and inviting, and the place is impeccably maintained and neat. Definitely one of my favorite spots to unwind and enjoy a great meal!

**A Memorable Evening at East Coast at Madras Square**

Nestled within the charming ambience of Madras Square, East Coast is a gem that brings together great food, warm hospitality, and an inviting atmosphere. Our recent visit left us thoroughly impressed, and it's safe to say that this place offers more than just a meal-it delivers an experience.

From the moment we stepped in, the setting was nothing short of magical. The soft glow of lights, the rustic yet elegant decor, and the soothing blend of nature with modern comforts set the perfect tone for an unforgettable evening. As luck would have it, the weather played along, with a gentle drizzle adding a poetic touch to our dinner. Opting for outdoor seating under a closed roof, we found ourselves immersed in the rhythmic sounds of the rain-a serene backdrop for the feast that was about to unfold.

The culinary journey began with piping-hot soups, rich in flavor and crafted to perfection. Each course seamlessly followed, delivering a delightful blend of taste and texture that kept us wanting more. The main course was indulgent yet refined, celebrating fresh ingredients and masterful preparation. And then came the grand finale-dessert. Every bite was heavenly, a perfect ending to an extraordinary meal.

But what truly set the evening apart was the atmosphere. Dining while watching an intense IPL match, with the sound of rain complementing the cheers and celebrations, was an experience like no other. It was a beautiful contrast-comforting food, a lively game, and nature's gentle embrace, all blending effortlessly into one unforgettable night.

East Coast at Madras Square is a place where food meets artistry and ambience enhances every flavor. Whether you're looking for a quiet evening or a lively gathering, this restaurant promises an experience worth cherishing. Highly recommended!

East Coast at Madras Square is a romantic dining gem! The candlelight dinners set the perfect ambiance, making it ideal for a special evening. The food was exceptional ‚Äì we loved the Herb Garlic Prawns, Bacon Pizza, Alfredo Sauce Pasta, and Roasted Beef Stir Fry. Every dish was top-notch, showcasing the chef's skill and attention to detail. If you're looking for a romantic dinner with great food and atmosphere, East Coast is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

places.generalDescription: Dakshina Chitra Heritage Museum in Chennai offers a comprehensive experience of South Indian culture, traditions, and artworks. The museum features 18 historical houses and showcases art, crafts, music, and dance forms from four major South Indian states. Visitors can explore exhibits on pre-colonial clothing, farming practices, and architecture. Additionally, the museum hosts performances and has stalls selling traditional jewelry, fashion items, and souvenirs.

sources.snippet: Dakshina Chitra or the south gallery is a living history museum that narrates the Tamil history and culture of times gone by. This small open air gallery-cum-village houses replicas of South India everyday life artefacts from 19th and 20th Century. You get to see the folk, craft, art, architecture and much more used by the local fishermen and villagers.

reviews.text: DakshinaChitra Heritage Museum is a must-visit place in Chennai to experience South Indian culture, art, and architecture. The traditional houses from different states are beautifully preserved and give you a glimpse of history and heritage. There are live crafts, art workshops, and cultural performances that make the visit even more engaging. The campus is well maintained, peaceful, and spacious - perfect for families, students, and anyone interested in culture. A truly enriching and memorable experience.

In today's electronic age, children are growing up with limited understanding of their roots and a diminished appreciation for what they possess. This place offers a wonderful opportunity to visit and impart knowledge of our heritage. They have meticulously recreated various aspects of South Indian cultures and related replicas, while also actively promoting historical arts and handicrafts. I strongly recommend that families, especially those seeking to instill values in their children, consider a day outing here. It's a commendable initiative supported by excellent companies.

Great place. Presents a slice of South India. Very well maintained. Some shows, puppetry on the weekends, for instance available. Great place to click some pictures: several South Indian style houses, art exhibits, sculptures and artifacts. Favours the folk, and the Tamil. Ideologically left leaning. Need at half a day to have a meaningful visit.

Bags are not allowed inside. Amenities available. Shops sell you stuff, beautiful stuff, but expensive. No exclusively vegetarian eatery inside.

Must visit if you are in and around Chennai.

One of the best theme parks in Chennai.
Awesome rides with a well organized water park. Food and eateries are decent, skill games, and fancy stores are also around. My favorite was the roller coaster, the RANGER and adult slides in the water park. Awesome experience.

Good place to hangout with kids, family, and friends. Better to avoid during weekends as it will be very crowded with school children coming here for excursion trips and would have to wait a for a long time in queue to attend each and every rides. Water rides are amazing and much more relaxing after the lunch.

If you are lucky to get tickets during any sale like the Black Friday sale, it's worth the amount.

Reducing one star because of the expensive items inside the theme park. A tin of soft drink costing at ‚Çπ70 and normal water bottle at ‚Çπ30, which ideally is just ‚Çπ20 outside.

Good place to hang out with friends and families.

Sometimes offers might be there in their site so check it once before going directly to ticket counter for buying tickets.

They have normal ticket (need to wait if crowded) and priority pass ticket (no waiting in queue)

Plenty of parking spaces available but it is 200m away from entrance.
For car -100rs and bike it's 50rs as parking fee.

Good adventurous rides are available like ranger, roller coaster, water coaster, etc.

Swimming pool, wave pool, waterfall, rain dance floor are available to have fun.

Wave pool is small when compared with other theme park.

If you are going with girl child or girls then be safe since everyone is enjoying in pool. I don't think, there is a separate pool for kids & women.

By evening time there will be a dance floor lightening with few dancers and anyone can go and dance with them if you want.

places.address: 1/74, East Coast Rd, Muthukadu, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 603112, India

places.generalDescription: Aqua is a laid-back and classy poolside restaurant located in the heart of the city, offering a dazzling view from its rooftop setting. It's an ideal spot for enjoying drinks and Mediterranean nibbles while lounging by the pool or catching up on work. The atmosphere is perfect for a relaxed day with your partner, exuding a romantic vibe complemented by live music and a cool breeze.

sources.snippet: Aqua is a very romantic place located in the center of the city. With the cool breeze tossing your hair and the live music played by the pool will make the whole scenario filmy and memorable. The most loved food here in the main course is Raita, Dal, Indian bread and Biryani.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

places.name: Aqua

reviews.text: Amazing experience! The captain and bartender were excellent. Abhijeet followed our order instructions perfectly, while Bhaskar truly impressed us with custom cocktails made to our taste, way beyond the menu. Great service, great vibes. Highly recommended! Please ask him to make Bhaskar special cocktail and get surprised.

Aqua In The Park Is A Rooftop Poolside Alfresco Restaurant That Has Introduced A New Menu Serving Tandoori Mini Idly, Chicken 65, Mutton Seekh Kebab, Pasta, Pizza, Cheesecake & More.

Tandoori Mini Idly: Mini Idly Coated With Parmesan & Cream, Cooked In A Tandoor & Served With Mint Chutney. Rich, Creamy & Tasty. Must Try.

Peri Peri Paneer Fingers: Panko-Fried Cottage Cheese Fingers Served With Spicy BBQ Sauce. Crunchy & Tasty.

Crispy Fried Chicken 65: Chicken 65 Tossed With Cashew Nuts, Bell Peppers & Barbeque Sauce. Chicken Was Tender & Tasted Very Good.

Bade Miyan Mutton Seekh Kebab: Minced Lamb Cooked In A Tandoor, Served With Mint Chutney. Tasted Good.

Grilled Bay Of Bengal Prawns: Prawns Cooked In Red Pepper Garlic Sauce With Sundried Tomatoes & Olives. Prawns Were Meaty & Tasty.

Penne Alfredo: Penne Alfredo Pasta Topped With Sundried Tomatoes & Olives. Tasted Good.

Tandoori Prawns Pizza: Thin-Crust Pizza Topped With Roasted Bell Peppers, Jalapeno & Prawns. Tasted Good.

Maa Ki Dal, Boconccini Cheese: Dal Makhani Topped With Boconccini Cheese. Tasted Good.

Mixed Vegetable Jalfrezi With Corn: Bengali-Style Gravy Of Mixed Vegetables & Corn. Tasted Good.

Mutton Rara Seekh Kebab Masala: Mutton Curry Topped With Mutton Seekh Kebab. Tasted Good.

Cheesecake: Cheesecake Topped With Mixed Berries Compote. Smooth & Tasty.

Tiramisu: Classic Recipe Of Late Chef Antonio Carluecio, Who Curated The Recipe With Mylapore Filter Coffee When He Visited The Hotel In 2005. Yummy & Tasty.
One of my favorite ramen spots in the city, super underrated. Chef Aniket does a fabulous job! Adela and the other others make you feel right at home! Big ups!

places.generalDescription: Sorgam @ Crimson Chakra is a charming restaurant in Chennai that offers an elegant venue with a tranquil garden area. It is well-known for its romantic atmosphere and exclusive candlelight dinner room for couples. The restaurant serves delicious North and South Indian flavors and stands out for providing a separate space for dog owners, complete with a rooftop area. The bright and pleasant interiors add to the dining experience.

sources.snippet: The food and the ambiance of Crimson Chakra can be compared to music. How music takes you to a different world giving you peace and charm, this place also gives a similar feel. It is situated in a noiseless place where you can even hear a pin drop.

places.name: Sorgam @ Crimson Chakra

reviews.text: The restaurant was very clam and there was lot of options for Non-veg as well as veg. Really loved how all dishes were cooked exquisite traditional style and ingredients also. A special thanks Mr Prasad his hospitality, he was very patient and explained clearly about all the special items. Surely will visit again to try more dishes.

Sorgam is truly a paradise for non-veg lovers, with plenty of good options for vegetarians too! Every dish we tried was delicious, and there was nothing to complain about. While the ambience is quite simple, the food makes it totally worth it. If you love South Indian non-veg food, this place is a must-try at least once.

Our experience at Sorgam was pleasant-the food was served quickly, and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. I visited with my cousins, who love non-veg food, and they absolutely enjoyed it. As a vegetarian, I was happy to see a good selection of dishes for us as well. Their Thali is perfect for sharing between two people. The unique display of starters before ordering is a great touch, making it easier to choose what to try. Definitely a place worth visiting!

We had pleasant experience at Sorgam. The ordered food was served quickly to us. The food was tasty and staffs were very cordial. Would like to highlight service of Vinod. Would like to comeback to taste their lunch dishes. Pls do share your experiences.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a Colonial-era bungalow surrounded by lush lawns, Kipling Cafe offers an elegant fusion of Asian and continental cuisine. The cafe's old-world charm is complemented by a tropical ambiance, creating a unique dining experience. Guests can choose to dine in the shady garden or on the sea-view roof terrace, both offering stunning views and an intimate atmosphere. With antique furniture, white muslin curtains, and carved granite pillars, the cafe exudes romance and tranquility.

sources.snippet: Breezy outdoors, twisting fairy lights, white cabanas, and an attached bar - date night couldn't get better than at  Kipling Cafe. They have a rooftop place if you want a view by the beach or you can have a cosy candlelight dinner as well. They offer Thai, Continental as well as North Indian delicacies to choose from.

reviews.text: It was a nice place to have dinner with your favorite one, such a pleasant ambience and foods are very nice with a standard quality of drinks. I'm very much satisfied by their service. Spent around 3k  for 2 persons.

The food was really good and tasty but the service is extremely poor. For each and everything you need to wait for 5 mins for someone to notice you and 2 mins for them to come to you to listen to your orders and 10 mins for it to be served and if u need anything again ‚Ä¶ repeat the process.

What is the point of good food if it is being offered with poor service

Visited on 19th april

places.name: Basil With a Twist

reviews.text:
This cafe is close to Valluvarkottam and has a silent and clean neighbourhood. The parking space is enough to accommodate 2-3 cars, and few bikes at a time.

The ambience is pleasing and is spacious enough to easily accommodate 50 persons at a time.

This cafe offers a wide variety of dishes to choose from. And most of them are quite new fused dishes that are hard to find in many other cafes in this city. The time taken to serve the dishes was quite slow, but it is perfect when we either go as a couple (Date) or for a business meeting.

The taste of most of the dishes were close to perfect and the quantity seemed good for the rates offered. I would highly recommend trying their soups and starters.

A perfect cafe in the city for a date.

food is tasty here. Good restaurant for a lunchout with our loved one. Very quiet place with cosy ambience, with peaceful lamp lights. Today climate is chill ‚òîüå¶Ô∏è,rainy outside so it was very nice experience here watching out from the window. Had a soup, Pizza and a Chicken appetizer that made us full today's lunch. Can visit during weekends. Parking is also available. Service is also good and helpful here. Take a Lunchout and Enjoy!

Eclectic, quaint and cozy!¬†¬†That's Basil With a Twist for you, located at Habibullah Road Chennai.  Have been a frequent here for quite some time now with no regrets.
The ambience is quiet and laid back.¬†¬†The seating is comfortable with ample space. The service is passable though you need to wait a while to get their attention.¬†¬†The pricing is a tad bit high, though.
Minestrone Soup, Grilled Fish with Pepper sauce and the Frittata were swell.

The rustic ambiance and unique cabanas create an intimate setting for couples. You can even arrange for special romantic touches like roses and candle lights to make the evening extra special.

sources.snippet: This Italian restaurant is perfect if you're looking to have a hearty meal in a peaceful setting with your S.O. Take your pick from cheesy pasta or a freshly baked pizza and have a lovely conversation in the warm, serene setting (they've got thatched roofs too). places.name: Mascarpone Cafe

reviews.text: We went for Candle Light Dinner on Feb 3. It was a wonderful experience. Service was so  good and the decoration also worth for the money. Food also good, and their Desserts and mojitos are outstanding. Must visit place to experience their food and ambience.. Special Thanks for the excellent Service!!!

A very pleasant experience. Ambience is good but can improve small things like the table, chairs and plates. Food is great here and very affordable option compared to other Italian cafes. Been here twice and to mention, both the times they have surprised us with some complementary dessert and their service is very kind.

Frankly, the place wasn't that great (overall). The service is pathetically slow and the waiter not speaking English and being clueless about what we just said doesn't help either. There's a lack of waiters so you can't even inquire about your order if you need to.

We waited 1 hour for two pathetic mocktails that weren't even good. One starter arrived quickly and one dish took 40mins and the other 50mins (in total). Such slow service despite only less than 8 guests at the place. Every single time we told the waiter one thing, he left somewhere on a scooter and took a long time to come back???

It seems there is a lack of proper organisation and management at this place.

Which is a shame because the ambience is actually good and the area is peaceful and clean, with ample parking on the street. It's a nice place to relax. I do wish the table and curtains were clean cause they looked dirty. It's not that difficult to wash them‚Ä¶

The food was fine. Nothing to write home about. Pretty average all in all. Half the menu wasn't available for some reason so our choices were limited.

I would not recommend visiting this place. There are definitely better places in ECR.

It has one of those dreamy decors with pastel colours and drapes, making it look all the more charming. Apart from its aesthetics, soothing interiors and cosy ambience; it also has some really nice food.

places.name: Chamiers Cafe

reviews.text: Food is good and offers a range of options. Not to mention, people would love the atmosphere here. It could be a comforting nook for you amidst a hustle and bustle of the city life. Tea was way better than coffee. Coffee beans they are using are a wee bit on an acid and stronger side with no delicate notes of nuts or chocolate. I recommend main courses and some side menus.

A relaxed place for a lazy reading day with amazing coffee and good food. The place has different sections of seating. Ground floor has women's boutique and first floor has a men's wear section, women's jewellery and cafe. The cafe itself has two partitions. One with beautiful chairs and meant for a date brunch or casual meetings. The second section is more cozy with books lined on shelves and cushioned chairs and sofas. Pick any book you like, read for how ever long you want. Their selection of breakfasts and coffees are definitely worth more visits. Hosts and servers are friendly and helpful with any queries about the menu. The waiting time is fairy short in the mornings but lunch rush will have you waiting for at least twenty minutes. But it's worth all the waiting.
Definitely hungry to try more dishes!

Very calm and neat space for any kind of hangout. Work friendly too! I have a very mixed opinion in food, yes it is overpriced and veg pizza was way too cheesy, sea food pizza was too bland. Only the arabiata pastas were enjoyable but also with extra tanginess. Dessert varieties are as same as wild garden cafe and the taste was üëåüèª. Luxury with a very very average dining and unresponsive service; Keeping the restrooms and washrooms downstairs did not feel very hospitable. Couldn't recommend for a good meal.

places.generalDescription: Muttukadu Boat House is a popular destination in South India, known for its boating and backwaters of the Bay of Bengal. It's located near MGM Dizzee World, Dakshinachitra, and Covelong Beach, making it an ideal spot for couples to enjoy romantic boat rides. This state government-owned facility offers a variety of boats, from sleek speedboats to spacious pontoons.

sources.snippet: Muttukadu Boat House is a scenic location surrounded by lush green trees and hills, making it a peaceful and serene destination. It is among the most renowned names on the list of places in Chennai for couples. With its serene surroundings, this boat house offers couples a chance to escape the hustle and bustle of city life.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Places to Visit in Chennai for Couples in 2024

sources.snippet: Come to Muttukadu Boat House if you want to spend time with your partner in the backwaters. The choice to take boat cruises is the appropriate one. Powerboating, speed boating, and shared boating are all options.
sources.shortName: Ideal places In Chennai That Will Provide You With A Romantic Getaway

places.name: Muttukadu Boat House

reviews.text: We took a speed boat ( 3 members) and paid 1200 for a 10 minute ride. The ride was very thrilling and it was a wonderful experience. Speed boat is a must try here !

Muthukadu Boat Club is a hidden gem for anyone seeking a peaceful escape near Chennai! The tranquil backwaters and lush surroundings make it an ideal spot for boating and relaxation. The pedal boats and rowboats are fun and well-maintained, offering a great way to enjoy the scenic beauty. The staff is friendly and helpful, adding to the pleasant experience. While the food options are decent, a bit more variety would be a welcome addition. The place is perfect for families, couples, and solo travelers looking to unwind. A few upgrades to the facilities, like seating areas and restrooms, could make it even better. Overall, a must-visit for a serene day out by the water! üåäüö§

Good place for boating. They have different boats - speed boat, motor boat, row boat, water scooter and pedal boat. We took a motor boat which costs rs 1020 for 20min. It was a fun ride in the backwaters. We can see some birds during the boat ride. They even click pictures in a dslr at an extra cost. A restaurant and small snack shops are also present in the premises. Parking is also available.

places.generalDescription: B.M. Birla Planetarium is a modern facility located within the Periyar Science and Technology Centre campus at Kotturpuram. It offers visitors a virtual tour of the night sky and hosts astronomy shows on its specially perforated hemispherical aluminum inner dome. The planetarium features 360-degree theater for an immersive experience. Additionally, it has 8 galleries with over 500 exhibits showcasing various aspects of science and technology.

sources.snippet: Birla Planetarium in Chennai is a great place for a family outing. Birla Planetarium, located in Kotturpuram, Chennai, hosts numerous cosmic shows and virtual tours of the solar system. You can take your children here to learn about the planets, stars, and other terms associated with the solar system.

sources.snippet: Description: One of the most romantic spots in Chennai is the Birla Planetarium, where you can both marvel at the cosmos. Take in spectacular sky displays and spend quality time together as a couple while gazing at the stars.
sources.shortName: Discover The Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

sources.snippet: Well, here‚Äôs where you see the moon and the planets and the stars in Chennai. For a marginal cost!. The Birla Planetarium is home to telescopes and entrapments and equipments that allow you to see into space.

sources.snippet: Description: Journey through the cosmos together at Birla Planetarium. Witness captivating celestial shows and stargaze with your loved one, deepening your connection.
sources.shortName: Discover the Top 20 Romantic Places in Chennai | by Time2Digital Media

places.name: B.M. Birla Planetarium

reviews.text:
Visiting the Birla Planetarium and Periyar Science and Technology Centre in Chennai was a great experience. There's a lot to see from life-size rocket models like the GSLV and BrahMos to interactive science exhibits. The 360-degree 3D sphere show was definitely a highlight really immersive and well done. I also found the weighing machine that shows your weight on different planets pretty cool.

The human evolution section with displays on early humans and Neanderthals was interesting and there were plenty of exhibits covering space chemistry and physics. The outdoor area had some dinosaur models though a few could use some maintenance. There were also some defense and technology exhibits adding to the variety. I noticed another 3D show but I didn't have time to check it out.

Overall it's a great place for anyone interested in space and science. Definitely worth a visit especially for students and families

It was awesome visiting this place with the kids!  Totally recommend it.  Grab the combo ticket and check out the three amazing shows.

Adult tickets are ‚Çπ60 and kids' tickets are ‚Çπ30 for the planetarium, science center, and 3D show package.  "Science on Sphere" is ‚Çπ20 for adults and ‚Çπ10 for kids.

The Planetarium can show all kinds of celestial movements.  They use special projectors to make the astronomical stuff look incredible on the dome.

Popular exhibits include the Solar System, stars, seasons, comets, and the moon landing.  There's also a cool DRDO pavilion.

The "Dawn of the Space Age" show is a mind-blowing Mirrordome+ experience ‚Äì super realistic space travel visuals.

Children's park is free of charges. For planetarium charges above 12 years of Rs. 80 and below 12 years Rs.40. Car parking Rs. 20.
3D show is amusing and the planetarium gives good knowledge about the universe too the children.
Nearly maintained. Children can spend hours here.

places.name: Bay View

reviews.text:
Lovely setting by the beach. Food was excellent üëå as was the very attentive service.
Highly recommend
Day time can get very humid.. but perfect for a family or romantic dinner esp if you are seated at the front so you have unparallel sea views
A great place to dine by the beach. Food was excellent. It's mostly South Indian sea food dishes. Though you do get Chicken items. Service is wonderful.

A dream for Seafood Enthusiasts, situated right besides the very coast, with a cozy and delightful ambience especially at the night. This sums Bay View up

Their speciality for me is the Kovalam Curry. Basically a tangy onion-garlic curry with tamarind and a bit of spice that you can order with any seafood you want- I tried it with fish and prawns. The salty sea-food taste paired beautifully with this flavourful curry.

Pair it with their idiyappams, rice and parotta. I'm not a big fan of the Parotta though. It's a bit on the drier side and I've had much better Parotta outside:

There aren't too many good veg options, but their veg Kurma is amazing with idiyappam. Otherwise, the veg menu feels not worth it at all for the price. I tried a paneer starter from here which tasted terrible, overly spiced with chutney powder or something like that

But turn to seafood, the obvious speciality and this place is a banger. They serve full grills of whole fish, crabs, lobsters and prawns and also classic seafood dishes from Fish and Chips to Calamari. Both the Indian and foreign crowd that stay in this Taj will love the offerings.

It's a Taj Restaurant so quite obviously it's priced extremely high. But the food quality is definitely top class too so you can't complain. The price also accounts for the amazing seaside ambience. The chef is also very hospitable and talked to us in the table.

You cannot possibly not eat here if you stay in Taj Fisherman's Cove, or even if you visit the resort for any reason. The highlight of the entire hotel for sure.

reviews.text: Had an amazing time at above sea level! The service was fantastic, and the desserts were prepared flawlessly. the manager on duty md. Nazeer and patra took care of all of our needs and went above and beyond with his hospitality.
Everything there was so good... Ambience, the food and customer service.And they also had lice singers in the house.. they were also awesome.

Been here recently-ambience was great, food was good, couple of dishes were really great- mushroom baklava and avocado toast, risotto was a miss, chicken and mash potato was good- can see the Chef really inspired to show his handiwork! Negatives- we were asking for a table in the upper deck and it was not given as it was reserved for regulars, we booked through dine out app and it said it was 30% of the total bill including alcohol but we had to pay alcohol bill separately- so is it a marketing gimmick from both parties? Kudos to the guys who waited on us as they went and above and beyond to make it a pleasant experience.

places.generalDescription: The Theosophical Society, founded in New York in the late 19th century and later relocated to Chennai, embraces the principle of universal brotherhood regardless of race or religion. Its lush grounds feature a remarkable garden with diverse trees and an ancient banyan tree spanning thousands of square meters. Visitors can revel in the tranquility away from urban noise and explore various religious monuments on site, including a church, mosque, Hindu temple, Buddhist shrine, and Zoroastrian fire altar.

sources.snippet: The Theosophical Society holds the green environment that can make anyone calm. The place is in the corner of Chennai and falls between the coast and the Adyar River. The place houses a 100 Acre area which gives anyone enough space to roam around.

reviews.text:
One of the best place to go for a leisure walk, despite the odd opening hours! When we think about why those hours are offered for the visitors, it does makes sense. This few hours of visiting time leads to less ecological damage inside and hence preserve the nature in it's best form.

Once can enjoy being in nature's close proximity and fall in love with the tranquility inside. It would bring peace and calmness to your mind and soul.

This is one of the nature's extraordinary creation.
So exciting it is.
Clean track for a walk. Greenery around the road, multiple types of other trees.
The Banyan tree used to be one of the largest and oldest Banyan tree.

Beautiful and solence place with limited people crowd here. Security is maintained well and seperate mandatory procedures are maintained to enter here. Had a nice time with my friend here in surrounding and visiting the historic places inside this place and even we can able to see some Deers inside this location at early morning. Must visit place once in life time.

places.generalDescription: Azzuri Bay is a charming restaurant located in Chennai, offering stunning views of the Bay of Bengal and its islands. The establishment provides a diverse menu featuring delectable seafood, succulent steaks, and authentic Indian cuisine. Situated in Gandhi Nagar, Adyar, the rooftop setting allows guests to enjoy a romantic dining experience with breathtaking vistas of the Adyar estuary merging into the sea and lush green surroundings.

sources.snippet: Azzuri Bay, located in the heart of Chennai, is one of the most romantic restaurants in the city. At Azzuri Bay, you can also indulge in their delectable cuisine that features a mix of international and local dishes. The restaurant also features a well-stocked bar with a range of cocktails, wine, and other beverages to complement your meal.
sources.shortName: 10 Romantic Places to Visit in Chennai for Couples in 2024

sources.snippet: This restaurant offers some finger-licking delicacies in addition to a romantic setting!. It lies in Adyar region of Chennai and costs INR 1000 for two approximately. It offers numerous cuisines including Italian, Chettinad Thai, South Indian, Sea Food and Mediterranean.
sources.shortName: 16 Best Romantic Places In Chennai (UPDATED 2024)

sources.snippet: For those who want to have a perfect candle light lunch or dinner, Azzuri Bay is the place. It can accommodate almost 140 people. It serves Italian, Mexican and Mediterranean cuisine which is loved by much more than the Chettinad Cuisine.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

sources.snippet: The most romantic thing about rooftop restaurants is the sunsets!. So, here we are with one of the most beautiful dining rooftop restaurants in Chennai, Azzuri Bay. The ambiance here is perfect for a date night.
sources.shortName: Explore 8 Fantastic Historical and Romantic Places in Chennai
Romantic Restaurants for Candle Light Dinner in Chennai Guide

places.name: Azzuri Bay

reviews.text: They're professional chefs who served continental items in original taste of that country. I surprised to see that it's very affordable compared to other continental restaurants.  We tried laksha soup, honey glazed lotus stem, Burmese noodles, milk cake.  All are top notch in taste. It's like a hidden gem.

Reached the place late than we planned, only realised that this place closes by 3pm later. Orange juice was perfect with only fresh oranges and enough sugar, the best OJ I ever had. Butter fried prawns were awesome in taste and spiciness. The chicken rolls was good but a bit dry the dipping saw they provided was niche spicy hot sauce and mango saw was nice too. Couldn't order any main as it was almost 2:45. The waiter nudged us for the last order and we went for the dessert instead of main. We ordered 2 panacotta one with mango and other with pomegranate. I think they used grape jelly instead of pomegranate. But it was too good to not eat, we cleaned it up in a jiffy

Azzuri Bay is a fantastic Italian restaurant with delicious food that impressed me from start to finish. The crab wontons were a standout ‚Äì absolutely loved them! While the prices might be a bit on the higher side, the service is top-notch and truly exceptional. They offer romantic candlelight dinners and even have a special surprise room with beautiful flower and candle decorations, perfect for special occasions. It's a bit pricier at around ‚Çπ5,000 with food included, but it's worth it for the experience. Highly recommend for a memorable dining experience!

places.address: 13, 1st Cres Park Rd, Gandhi Nagar, Adyar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600020, India

places.generalDescription: Bella Ciao is an Italian food court nestled in the residential area of Kottivakkam, Chennai. The restaurant offers a charming ambiance with wooden furnishings and tea lights, creating a delightful setting for dining. Guests can choose between indoor seating during hot summer days or alfresco dining to enjoy pleasant weather. With a diverse Italian menu, visitors can savor their favorite dishes while enjoying live music in the spacious outdoor garden patio.

sources.snippet: It has an open alfresco dining with some cool breeze on non-summer days as well as indoor seating to avoid the sun during summer. It is a comfortable place with beautiful ambiance. Bella Ciao serves Italian cuisine and offers homemade bread, steaks, and pasta for all the vegetarians as well as non-vegetarians.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

sources.snippet: If you have seen Money Heist, you‚Äôll be a fan of this place already!. The decor and settings are perfect for romantic dining and the live music adds all the more spice. The place offers authentic Italian food and you can go on singing Bella Ciao all through your evening.
sources.shortName: Explore 8 Fantastic Historical and Romantic Places in Chennai

sources.snippet: Feature: Casual Dining, Romantic dinner, Italian, outdoor garden, live music. Approx cost: 1000 - 1200 for two. Address: Lounge Beach Garden, No.4, Shri Krishna Enclave, Kottivakkam, Chennai, 600041
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants for Candle Light Dinner in Chennai Guide

sources.snippet: It‚Äôs an Italian restaurant that is famous for pizza and lasagna. The ambiance is inviting, and live music adds more romance to it. As a few Italians run the place, expect the food to be authentic.
sources.shortName: 18 Places to Visit in Chennai with Girlfriend for the Perfect Date (2024)

places.name: Bella Ciao

reviews.text: If you are a lover of Italian food, then this is definitely a must visit place!!!! They serve proper Italian food and I guess it is run by Italians (i am not completely sure). The menu has a wide variety of choices (Wide would be an understatement). I have tried the starters and main course. And I must say the food was simply amazing and extremely delicious. To be frank i enjoyed every single bite. They have a squid starter and without a second thought I can say that it was the tastiest squid dish i have ever tasted and I would also include it in the list of the best dishes i have ever had. I loved everything that I ordered. They also serve yummy pizzas with a variety of choices . I enjoyed the ambience equally. With all the fairy lights and small huts, it looks beautiful and would be an apt place for a romantic dinner date. Bella ciao is undoubtedly one of the best hotels i have ever been to !!! I would suggest all italian food lovers to please visit this place and enjoy the food and the ambience üòäüòä

Its a nice place to hangout with friends. The ambiance is amazing but too costly to make a hole in your pocket. Also the pizza I ordered didn't have any taste. Probably next time would try ordering something else.

The place is located at the ECR Beach. The ambiance has open air and full greenery around. It's quite a romantic place to go with your gf/bf.
The menu has good of variety of Italian dishes. The service is really nice.
We ordered Pizza and some Italian chicken dish. It was too good. Pizza was wood fired. The quantity was sufficient.
It is on an expensive side though.
Overall a very good experience.

places.address: Shri Krishna Enclave, No.4, Valmiki Nagar, Kaveri Nagar, Kottivakkam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041, India

places.generalDescription: Thalankuppam Pier is a serene and picturesque location in the northern part of Chennai, offering a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle. Situated where the Thalankuppam River meets the sea, this pier is ideal for those seeking tranquility. It's perfect for romantic strolls with stunning views of the sea and refreshing ocean breeze. The area is known for its breathtaking sunsets, especially against the backdrop of a thermal power plant.

sources.snippet: Description: Thalankuppam Pier, one of Chennai‚Äôs most picturesque locations, is a great spot to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and spend some quality time with your significant other. Take a romantic stroll down the pier and enjoy the serene waters and refreshing sea air together.
sources.shortName: Discover The Top 20 Romantic Places In Chennai

sources.snippet: Description: Thalankuppam Pier offers a serene escape from the city‚Äôs hustle and bustle. Walk hand in hand along the pier, watching the tranquil waters and enjoying the cool sea breeze.
sources.shortName: Discover the Top 20 Romantic Places in Chennai | by Time2Digital Media

places.name: Thalankuppam Pier

reviews.text:
It's a hidden gem near Chennai. The view of the refineries and factories, the sunset views in this place are awesome. This place is not for young kids and women's since it's little deserted and very less people visit here. I just saw few locals fishing here.
My dear Drone Lovers‚Ä¶pls come and fly your drones here for an amazing videography and photography.

A quite place to have some time alone or with friends. Won't recommend for family since there is no proper walkway or place to sit or any shops nearby. It's a kind of isolated. Have to climb on large rocks to sit.
This place is quite popular among anglers and you can see a lot of people enjoying fishing. Since there is a very low footfall, you can have a very relaxed atmosphere. The only sound you will hear is waves crashing onto rocks and occasional fishing boats going out to sea.

Such a beautiful serene place to experience sunrise. Quite the drive to get to the place. The roads around are well maintained and there is a shore to enjoy the beach as well. The place is rocky and not recommended for kids or the elderly. Does not require any trek of sorts.

places.address: Beach Rd, Nettukuppam, Ennore, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600057, India
